channel.title: Player death timing
channel.description: Ok so I have been searching for this and have even tried this but it has not worked. I've been searching for about three weeks now and well It doesn't seem like you can change the death timer. I am current using a PI base so please help. Also I have tried Player assistant but that didn't seem to work so please help!BTW I want the death timer to be decreased so it goes with the death animation.

item.title: Player death timing
item.dc:creator: @yo_dude_1345 yo dude 1345
item.description:
@yo_dude_1345 wrote:

Truthfully you bolth are wrong because the timer does not lie within playerassistant.java but in client.java

	if(isDead && respawnTimer == -6) {
		getPA().applyDead();
	}

	
	if(respawnTimer == 12) {
		respawnTimer = -6;
		getPA().giveLife();


				freezeTimer = -1;
	} else if(respawnTimer == 12) {
		respawnTimer--;
		startAnimation(836);

Read full topic

item.title: Player death timing
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

[quote=“imsuperman05, post:9, topic:406929”][quote author=ExtremeX-Scape™ link=topic=503912.msg3686959#msg3686959 date=1311903606]
Give me a second let me skim over some void’s, I’ll get back to you.

public void applyDead() 
{
    c.respawnTimer = 15;
}

Took me a whole 15 second’s.
[/quote][quote author=imsuperman05 link=topic=503912.msg3686958#msg3686958 date=1311903530]
Try public void applyDead()
Taking a stab at it but could be c.respawnTimer = ##;
[/quote]
GF I POSTED FIRST ftw…[/quote]
Cool.

Read full topic

item.title: Player death timing
item.dc:creator: @mrdrzj mrdrzj
item.description:
@mrdrzj wrote:

find a source that has the timing you want, and in that source search for death and replace the death timing code with your server death timing code, just search death or something like that
